Welcome to the Help Hub! I am Lady Fungus. I work diligently on updating this Help Hub machine to best serve you with the information you need. On the left-hand sidebar, you can find all the documentation links. You can also use the search bar on the top right corner.
Odysee Rewards Verification: Earn LBRY (LBC) Credits
Guide to logging into your Odysee account.
Resetting your Odysee password while not logged in.

One of Odysee's major differentiators from other media platforms is that Odysee is built on a blockchain called LBRY. In this section, we'll explore what exactly that means and how it affects Odysee. It's important to note, no one has to know a thing about blockchains in order to use and enjoy Odysee. It's similar to driving a car, you can drive one without understanding how the engine works. This section will focus primarily on how Odysee interacts with the LBRY protocol. For a more detailed look at every aspect of the LBRY protocol, visit https://lbry.com/faq.
Naming Here's how the naming works on Odysee. Ways to Increase LBC Stake How to increase your LBC Stake.
Here's how the naming works on Odysee.
How to increase your LBC Stake.

Welcome to the Memberships section! This section will cover everything there is to know about Odysee's new membership program. What are memberships? Memberships allow a creator to create subscription tiers for fans to support with monthly donations. Fans can donate to a creator via their channel or through the Donor Portal. We'll go over memberships from both the creator and member persepctive.

Portal Location The Creator Portal sounds cool. Where is it? Portal Sections Going over each section in the Creator Portal Creating Tiers Don't know how to make tiers or need some ideas? This section's for you. Members-Only Content Here's how to create members-only uploads, livestreams, and chat.

Most media platforms handle moderation in one of two ways: either the video platform itself has very strict rules for what can and can't be said in comment sections, or there are absolutely no rules whatsoever and commenters can say whatever they want wherever they want. Odysee has a different approach. We strongly believe in allowing creators to decide what is or is not tolerable in their own spaces. This means Odysee as a platform staying out of the way, while also giving creators tools for dealing with bad actors as they see fit. This section will cover the various moderation tools Odysee creators have to manage their own comment sections.
Odysee has a lot of moderation settings. Here's where to find them.
Every moderation setting and what they mean.

There are a lot of videos on Odysee, and a great way to organize them is through playlists. Whether it's creators making playlists for their own content, or playlists for others' content, playlists have a lot of uses. This section will cover everything to do with playlists on Odysee.
Finding your own playlists and others' public playlists.
Publishing playlists to make them public.

Uploading hundreds of old videos onto a new platform can be a daunting task. Fortunately, Odysee has a YouTube sync tool that allows YouTube creators to automatically mirror all past and future content to their Odysee channel. In this post, we'll go over some basics on the sync tool itself, provide a walkthrough, and answer a few commonly asked questions.
YouTube sync sounds cool. What is it, though?
